class_notes: Synchronous class attendance required. Timed, synchronous assessments. The course theme is "philosophies of life and lived experience." The course will focus on empiricist and existentialist philosophies (both broadly construed) from the 19th and 20th century, especially thinkers who consider the meaning of life and how lived experience shapes our understanding of the nature of truth and reality.
course_description: This course will introduce principal figures and topics in nineteenth- and twentieth-century philosophy.
sections: Class Nbr: 4317, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: MW 11:20a-12:35p, Instructor: J. Mousie, Status: Open
